phrases: I'm doing really good. I'm here I'm just ready to quit smoking and but I've been having quite a hard time with it.
Started in high school, smoking here and there with friends or at parties... up to a pack and a half a day.
History of gout and type two diabetes.
Motivated because I am about to be a father any day... be there for my daughter growing up.
Tried to quit before by going cold turkey... relapsed due to work stress.
Stress can often be a trigger for smoking... started learning meditation and joined the gym.
Consider using a smoking cessation aid... friends mentioned the patch had success.
Chosen next Monday (birthday) as quit date.
Prescribed 21 mg nicotine patch... change location daily to avoid skin irritation.
Follow-up in two weeks to reevaluate patch dosage and discuss triggers.
Monitor stress levels, especially around new fatherhood... continue gym routine and meditation.
Maintain type two diabetes with diet/exercise... order hemoglobin A1c for next visit.
Continue allopurinol for gout... avoid uric acid-exacerbating foods.
Physical exam: clear lungs, regular heart rhythm, 2/6 systolic murmur, no carotid bruits.
Patient agrees to plan, no questions.
Congratulations on the baby... excited about next Monday as quit date.
